subject: Productivity
title: The Abilene Paradox
description: Learn The Abilene Paradox in one minute.

hook.text: A family drives 50 miles in the heat to Abilene. Nobody wanted to go. Nobody said so.

buildup.text: Jerry Harvey described this in 1974: groups often agree on actions nobody actually wants.

discovery.text: Each person assumes the others want it. Fear of rocking the boat creates false consensus.

twist.text: The Abilene Paradox is the opposite of groupthink. Everyone privately disagrees but publicly conforms.

climax.text: Simply asking does anyone actually want this can prevent hours of wasted collective effort.

punchline.text: Silence isn't agreement. It's often the opposite.

quiz.question: What is the Abilene Paradox?
options: Groups agreeing on actions nobody actually wants
Groups always making the best decision
Individuals making better choices than groups
